niagara.ndom
Interface DOMImplementation

All Known Implementing Classes:
SAXDOM, XercesJ, XercesJ2, XML4J
public interface DOMImplementation

DOMImplementation is the interface implemented by all DOM implementations.

Method Summary
 org.w3c.dom.Node importNode(org.w3c.dom.Document d, org.w3c.dom.Node n)
          Returns a version of a node that can be inserted in a (possibly different than its current) document (by deep cloning it if needed) This method is here just for the benefit of the old TXDOM parser -- it is part of DOM Level 2
 org.w3c.dom.Document newDocument()
          newDocument creates a new document node for this particular DOM implementation
 DOMParser newParser()
          newParser creates a new parser for this particular DOM implementation
 DOMParser newValidatingParser()
          newParser creates a new validating parser for this particular DOM implementation, if that's possible otherwise it returns a regular parser
 

Method Detail

newDocument

org.w3c.dom.Document newDocument()
newDocument creates a new document node for this particular DOM implementation

Returns:
the new Document node

newParser

DOMParser newParser()
newParser creates a new parser for this particular DOM implementation

Returns:
the new DOMParser

newValidatingParser

DOMParser newValidatingParser()
newParser creates a new validating parser for this particular DOM implementation, if that's possible otherwise it returns a regular parser

Returns:
the new DOMParser

importNode

org.w3c.dom.Node importNode(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                            org.w3c.dom.Node n)
Returns a version of a node that can be inserted in a (possibly different than its current) document (by deep cloning it if needed) This method is here just for the benefit of the old TXDOM parser -- it is part of DOM Level 2

Parameters:
d - a Document
n - a Node
Returns:
the (possibly cloned) Node
